title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep-debt-tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML designed to help users visualize and manage their accumulated sleep debt. This tool allows users to track their sleep patterns, calculate sleep debt based on personal goals, and provides insights to improve sleep habits. The repository showcases the use of TypeScript in a practical application and is tagged with the "project" and "typescript" topics for easy discovery.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed as a modern and intuitive platform for creating and participating in polls and voting events. It leverages the power of Next.js for server-side rendering and efficient routing, providing a seamless user experience for organizing and managing various voting scenarios, making it an ideal project for learning and implementing practical web development skills.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository hosts a web-based interface, built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, designed to visualize and interact with data from a Robofleet system. This project enables users to monitor robot status, track task progress, and analyze performance metrics, providing a comprehensive overview of the Robofleet ecosystem.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the TeX source code and generated HTML for my resume, showcasing my skills and experience. It serves as a personal project to maintain an up-to-date and easily shareable resume in both printable and web-friendly formats. The project utilizes LaTeX for professional formatting and HTML for online accessibility.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a full-stack project built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router), TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI) to provide a modern and efficient developer dashboard. It leverages React Query for data fetching and management, showcasing best practices for building performant and scalable web applications. This repository serves as a practical example of integrating these technologies to create a robust project, ideal for learning and reference.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: This project, built with HTML and Python, provides a map visualization tool. It allows users to interact with geographical data, potentially displaying locations, routes, or other spatial information. The repository explores practical application of web technologies in a project setting and likely incorporates data processing or API integration to generate the map visuals.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a simple CRUD application built with Python, Flask, and PostgreSQL, showcasing a basic project structure for web development. It utilizes HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting for front-end presentation and deployment automation, demonstrating a practical example of building and managing a database-driven web application using modern technologies.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built with Jupyter Notebook and Python, serves as a collection of projects focused on applying programming skills to finance. It explores various financial concepts and analyses through practical coding examples, offering a hands-on approach to learning finance with Python. The projects aim to provide users with a foundational understanding of financial modeling, data analysis, and algorithmic trading strategies.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project built using TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, demonstrating a modern dashboard application. This repository serves as a practical example of implementing a responsive and dynamic user interface with Next.js, showcasing best practices for structuring a project and integrating various components within a dashboard environment.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-event-calendar is a JavaScript-based project that creates a customizable and interactive event calendar web component. Built using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, this repository provides a modular solution for displaying and managing events with dynamic updates and a visually appealing interface. This project is designed to be easily integrated into various web applications.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository houses a modern, full-stack IoT asset tracking web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS, leveraging Supabase for backend data storage and authentication. The project aims to provide a user-friendly interface for monitoring and managing the location and status of various assets, demonstrating best practices for developing scalable and performant IoT solutions using cutting-edge web technologies.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a web application built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed as a collaborative project to facilitate brainstorming and idea organization. Leveraging a Next.js framework, this project allows users to create, visualize, and manage ideas on a dynamic and intuitive board, making it a central hub for project planning and creative collaboration.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a web application built with TypeScript, Vite, and Express.js that leverages the Gemini API to provide engaging and insightful conversations. This project explores AI-driven interactions and showcases the power of modern web development techniques, combining a clean front-end design with a robust back-end architecture to deliver a user-friendly and intelligent chat experience. HTML, CSS, and JavaScript complement the core technologies, ensuring a responsive and visually appealing interface.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: Ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool to visualize and analyze ROS (Robot Operating System) log files, enabling developers to efficiently debug and understand their robotic systems' behavior. Built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and shell scripting, this project provides a user-friendly interface to filter, search, and explore ROS logs, making it a valuable asset for robotics development and debugging workflows. This project focuses on providing better log visualization tools.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a full-stack e-commerce web application built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router), TypeScript, and React.  Leveraging MUI for the UI, it allows users to browse and purchase fruits. The project incorporates React Query for efficient data fetching and management, showcasing a modern, type-safe approach to web development and serving as a practical example of e-commerce implementation using cutting-edge technologies.
